page.title: 14Four Oaks- Transport
page.content: The district is well served with public transport,although the bus service has been subjected to cuts because of financial consideration following the governments decision that public transport should be more financially viable.There is a good local rail service to Birmingham which carries heavy commuter traffic at the peak periods in the mornings and early evenings.There is a scheme to provide an integrated Birmingham Light Rail Service, running partly underground, which might include this area.This plan is due for completion in 1990 and would be of great benefit.The main form of transport for most people is the motor car,either private or company owned.Parking facilities are a problem in the more commercial areas but some off-street parking has helped.The Motorway System is nearby.
